article_title: ACA Pay Rule Threatens Emergency Care, Suit Says
article_text:
ACA Pay Rule Threatens Emergency Care, Suit Says

Law360, New York (May 13, 2016, 5:54 PM ET) -- An Affordable Care Act regulation related to emergency-care reimbursement fails to ensure that providers will be properly paid and should be invalidated, according to a complaint filed Thursday in D.C. federal court.



The complaint from the 34,000-member American College of Emergency Physicians targets a final rule issued in November. The rule created a standard under which insurance plans must give out-of-network emergency-care providers the greatest of three payments: the plan’s in-network amount, the Medicare amount or the so-called usual, customary and reasonable amount, known as the...
